Comment.value: Bookshelf script (spawns in books or a mage scroll).
Bookshelf script (spawns in books or a mage scroll).

Chest - 1 (Low treasure script)

Detection DC: 25
Hardness DC: 10

Hidden trap door trigger V1.1

Make a waypoint that has a tag of DST_<tag of this trigger> and when the user opens and uses the door they will be moved to that location.

The reflex save is the distance in meters that the player can find the hidden door. 

The willpower save is the DC of finding this door.

Hidden trap door trigger V1.1

Make a waypoint that has a tag of DST_<tag of this trigger> and when the user opens and uses the door they will be moved to that location.

The reflex save is the distance in meters that the player can find the hidden door. 

The willpower save is the DC of finding this door.

Place this trigger.

Give it a KEY TAG (advanced page) = the number of the non-random interjection to display.
There must be a conversation script on the henchmen looking for this value.

Place this trigger.

KEY TAG is irrevelant.

Will attempt to say one of the random popups.


You must an appropriate Random#X conversation script for each random interjection.

Place this trigger.

KEY TAG is irrevelant.

Will attempt to say one of the random popups.


You must an appropriate Random#X conversation script for each random interjection.

Place this trigger.

KEY TAG does not matter. Will attempt a random interjection conversation.

There must be a conversation script on the henchmen looking for this value.

Place this trigger.

KEY TAG is irrevelant.

Will attempt to say one of the random popups.


You must an appropriate Random#X conversation script for each random interjection.
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.

This is the default waypoint you may place to set a patrol path for a creature or NPC.
1. Create the creature and either use its current Tag or fill in a new one.
2. Place or make sure the WalkWayPoints() is within the body of the On Spawn script for the creature.
3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.
